TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program Enhanced Edition Grand Discussion thread

Articles.Content:
Anyone know of any good YouTube robotics tutorials? Having trouble getting my head around the control unit.

Plus, the new science gear with breaking ground, does each unit need a separate power source? I packed everything I thought I'd need for a mun visit, and half says it's unpowered.

Oh and while I'm hear, what can we use the control action groups for?

Thanks in advance

I need help-when ever I play for a while, the pitch/yaw/roll input box while have pink triangles  spawn in it, and when they do no matter how I move my thumbsticks, the inputs affected by the pink triangles. Ea, if my pitch input has a pink triangle at the top of it, and I go to move my tumbstick, no matter which direction(up or down) the orange arrow will move towards the pink one and after that I have no choice but to revery my flight to a previous stage. Can anybody help me?
You can use the action groups for certain engines(I use then for VTOLs and SSTOs) just mess around with them till you get comfortable with their uses.

On 4/10/2020 at 2:18 AM, Lewie said:

I need help-when ever I play for a while, the pitch/yaw/roll input box while have pink triangles  spawn in it, and when they do no matter how I move my thumbsticks, the inputs affected by the pink triangles. Ea, if my pitch input has a pink triangle at the top of it, and I go to move my tumbstick, no matter which direction(up or down) the orange arrow will move towards the pink one and after that I have no choice but to revery my flight to a previous stage. Can anybody help me?

The pink arrows represent trim. LB/L1 and LS set trim. LB/L1 and L3 resets trim. You can turn trim off entirely in the settings.
Ok, how do I do that? Thank you for the information, it’ll prove helpful

35 minutes ago, Lewie said:

Ok, how do I do that? Thank you for the information, it’ll prove helpful 

How do you turn off trim in the settings?

 

Pause the game. Select 'settings' or 'options,' I can't remember which word they use. Scroll down and there should be an option to disable trim. It might be on one of the other tabs (not audio, obviously) but it's not a difficulty setting.

 

Personally I turn trim on for aeroplanes, it's useful in landing, but never for rockets as it's just not sensitive enough.

On 1/16/2018 at 8:52 AM, IronSchu said:

With regards to xbox one - how do you open/access the debug toolbar (menu)? 

Please advise

The cehat menu/ debug menu. Even though Ima PS4 player you ahve to plug in a keyboard with an adapter with is for sale on amazon. Then ypu hold ALT and F12 at the same time.

18 minutes ago, Dr. Kerbal said:

The cehat menu/ debug menu. Even though Ima PS4 player you ahve to plug in a keyboard with an adapter with is for sale on amazon. Then ypu hold ALT and F12 at the same time.

Actually, it’s this-

pause-

up, up, down, down, left right, left right. 

You’re welcome

On 6/2/2021 at 6:28 PM, PlutoISaPlanet said:

Landed on Ike and Duna the past few days. Only took 150 plus hours!

I managed to do Duna and Ike, but then struggled with Delta v for getting back, 3 rescue craft sent and tbf I like the parachute approach to landing as predictable landing. I do really hate having to wait for ejection windows when in career but I do like the game mode so I just send up a load of interplanetary missions at the same time

had to perform a full delete and reset of PS4 though and tried to restore my old career due to getting 3-4 blue screen crashes per play. Sadly, started a new career. it sucks you can't copy over old designs, some of my bases were pretty good. 

Hope you're still enjoying it. I struggle remembering to go to bed when I play
